page.title: 15TRADE AROUND GRAFTON
page.content: The Esso garage in Welford mainly sells petrol and oil to people from Welford and the surrounding villages. About 4000 gallons of petrol and 25 gallons of oil are sold per week, and this is delivered from a depot in Birmingham every eight or nine days. The mechanics repair about 30 cars a week. The Post Office in Welford which is run by two people also sells food and stationery. There are ten letter boxes in Welford and letters are collected twice a day and sent to Stratford, where the first class letters are removed and the rest forwarded to Leamington to be sorted. The Post Office pays out 250 old age pensions and l50 child benefits each week. In the summer a number of boat people come to the Post Offfice together with caravanners campers and also many foreign tourists.
